intro: Restio tetraphyllus subsp. meiostachyus, commonly known as the silver restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, evergreen leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
